p: In Canada, the 1998 assessment of health impacts of climate change did not explore the effects of climate change on food security, nor did an assessment in 2004 [ 65], but the 1998 study did recognize this as a high priority knowledge gap [ 66]. Subsequent national climate change and health assessments included examination of climate change impacts on food safety with some discussion of food insecurity threats in northern Canadian communities [ 4, 5].
